profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Saturday December 8, 2018 at 11:13

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The Transgender Collection includes illustrated publications and printed ephemera that chronicle transgender and gender variant communities, performance, and identities. The collection documents various aspects of these communities, including transvestism, drag queens, transitioning and sex reassignment surgery, and gender fluid and genderqueer identities, both from within and without the communities.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Transferred by the Larry Kramer Initiative Executive Coordinator, 2004. Transferred from the Librarian for Gay and Lesbian Studies, 2007. Transferred from the LGBT Co-Op, 2009. Transferred from the Librarian for Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual, and Transgender Studies and Women's, Gender, and Sexuality Studies, 2015. Transferred from the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, 2016.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright status for collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Transgender Collection (MS 1848). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The materials are arranged by accession.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Transgender Collection includes illustrated publications and printed ephemera that chronicle transgender and gender variant communities, performance, and identities. The collection documents various aspects of these communities, including transvestism, drag queens, transitioning and sex reassignment surgery, and gender fluid and genderqueer identities, both from within and without the communities.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This accession comprises nearly 350 items of printed ephemera documenting Northern California transgender, gender-queer and drag organizations, support groups, services providers, research studies, publishers, cinema, businesses, arts and entertainment, performers and authors. Much of it is focused on the San Francisco Bay area. Roughly half of the materials are related to fundraisers, parties, and theatrical events involving drag queens and drag queen culture, including organizations such as the Sisters of Perpetual Indulgence. The other half are related to services and events for transgender and gender-variant people.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This accession contains publications describing the Transgender Archives, located at the University of Victoria in Victoria, British Columbia, Canada. The materials include information about the collections held at the archives and related photographs of materials, history of the formation of transgender, history of the formation of the archive, information about using the archive, and information about donating to the archive. All materials date to 2014.

did.unittitle: Transgender Archives, University of Victoria publications
